en: He that dasheth in pieces is come up against thee: keep the fortress, watch the way, make thy loins strong, fortify thy power mightily.
hmr: Sukkawinâwitu chu i hmai- hmaa chun a hung suok ie, kul- bîng chu enkawl la, lampui chu vêng rawh, i kâwng chu sukngar la, i thil- thawtheina chu hrâttakin siem ṭha rawh.

en: For Jehovah restoreth the excellency of Jacob, as the excellency of Israel; for the emptiers have emptied them out, and destroyed their vine-branches.
hmr: Israelhai ropuina angin Jakob- hai ropuina chu LALPA chun ân ngîr nâwk sih a; sukruoktuhaiin anni chu an sukruok zo tah a, an grêp kauhai an suksiet zo ta sih a.

en: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men are in scarlet: the chariots flash with steel in the day of his preparation, and the cypress spears are brandished.
hmr: A mi hrâthai phaw chu a sen a, mi huoisenhai chu a sen inlârin an inthuom a, an inbuotsaina nia chun tawlailîrhai chu kâpathîr tlêtin a tle zawr zawr a, feihai chu râpthlâktakin ân lap zawk zawk a nih.

en: The chariots rage in the streets; they rush to and fro in the broad ways: the appearance of them is like torches; they run like the lightnings.
hmr: Tawlailîrhai chu kawtthlêra chun an tlân bur bur a, lamlien lien- haia chun an insuk sawk sawk a, meiser angin an inlang a, kâwlinlep angin an tlân thuok thuok a nih.

en: He remembereth his nobles: they stumble in their march; they make haste to the wall thereof, and the mantelet is prepared.
hmr: A mi lienhai chu a hrietsuok a, an fe inruol chu an pêm a; kul bang tieng pan chun an inhmawh a, thil phên ding an siem a.

en: The gates of the rivers are opened, and the palace is dissolved.
hmr: Vadung kawtkhârhai chu hawng a na, lal in chu sukramin a um a.

en: And it is decreed: she is uncovered, she is carried away; and her handmaids moan as with the voice of doves, beating upon their breasts.
hmr: Chun, Huzzab chu an hlîp a, an fe hmangpui a, a suoknuhai chun an âwm inchumin vaṭhu inhrâm ang elin an ṭah a.

en: But Nineveh hath been from of old like a pool of water: yet they flee away. Stand, stand, they cry; but none looketh back.
hmr: Tienlaia inthawk tah Ninevi khuo hi dîl ang a na; amiruokchu, an tlân hmang a, “Ngîr ro, ngir ro,” tiin an ko a, nisienlakhawm, tukhawm an ngha kîr nawh.

en: Take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold; for there is no end of the store, the glory of all goodly furniture.
hmr: Tangkaruo râllâkhai chu lâkpêk unla, rângkachak râllâk sumhai chu lâkpêk ro; thil sêkkhâwl le thuom- hnaw ṭha po po ropuizie chun tâwpintai a nei si nawh.

en: She is empty, and void, and waste; and the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, and anguish is in all loins, and the faces of them all are waxed pale.
hmr: Sukruokin a um a, a ruok dêr a, a rêm dêr a nih, lungril chu ân tui- hmang a, khûphai chu ân vuoktuoh a, kâwng po po chu a na ngawi ngawi a, an rênga hmêl chu a dâng zo vawng a nih.

en: Where is the den of the lions, and the feeding-place of the young lions, where the lion and the lioness walked, the lion’s whelp, and none made them afraid?
hmr: Tukhawm isukṭit loa an umna, sakeibakneichal dâm, sakeibaknei- pui dâm, an fe vêlna sakeibaknei bu zâwl le sakeibakneitehaiin an fâkna hmun chu khâw lai am a na?

en: The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his caves with prey, and his dens with ravin.
hmr: Sakeibakneichal chun a têhai khawp tâwk a keinâwi a, sakeibak- neipuihai ta dingin a se hlum a, a pûkhai chu a sasein a suksip a, a bu zâwlhai chu saruong kei nâwiin.

en: Behold, I am against thee, saith Jehovah of hosts, and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword shall devour thy young lions; and I will cut off thy prey from the earth, and the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun, “Ngai ta, ka do che a nih, i tawlailîrhai chu raw khu hlut hlut ka ta, i sakeibaknei têhai chu kâwlhnâmin bohmang an tih; chun, hnuoia i sase hi suktâwp ka ta, i palaihai râwl chu hriet ni ta naw ni,” a ta.
